channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13658] Improve the test run time for TestAccessController class
item.description: Improve the test run time for TestAccessController class
item.summary: Improve the test run time for TestAccessController class

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
How much improvement in test runtime does the patch achieve ?

Thanks

Locally I was able to see 3x times. But would like to see what Hadoop QA has got to say.
But Hadoop QA run, https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14006/console got terminated with the following error.

/home/jenkins/tools/maven/latest/bin/mvn clean install -DskipTests -Pcompile-protobuf -X -DHBasePatchProcess > /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/patchprocess/patchProtocErrors.txt 2>&1

======================================================================

There are Protoc compilation errors.

======================================================================

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.hadoop:hadoop-maven-plugins:2.5.1:protoc (compile-protoc) on project hbase-protocol: org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException: protoc version is 'libprotoc 2.4.1', expected version is '2.5.0' -> [Help 1]

something weird!

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12731933/13658.patch
against master branch at commit 9aeafe30b7d932e562f803fd071812cd27aebaf8.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12731933

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 8 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14007//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14007//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14007//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14007//console

This message is automatically generated.

I am not near system but then just saw the test report. Earlier it used to take around 5mins 12secs and 29secs for TestAccessController and Testcontrolleraccess2 to complete respectively and now with this patch it took only 49secs and 9secs respectively to complete the same.
The reports I have compared are https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14005/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access/ and https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14007/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access/

-1 in current form

If you're going to use the same table for every unit, each unit must now clean up after itself. Not every unit creates users and adds grants, but some do. Add cleanup code for when that is the case and I'll +1
Please rename setUp() and tearDown() methods as they can get confused for JUnit framework methods with the same names.

Andrew Purtell

Not every unit creates users and adds grants, but some do. Add cleanup code for when that is the case

I did this in first patch but only table and users which are available at class level.


+    // Grant the revoked permission back to the user

+    grantOnTable(TEST_UTIL, USER_RO.getShortName(), TEST_TABLE, TEST_FAMILY, null,

+      Permission.Action.READ);

but not for method level user.
In v1 patch I have addressed this for method level users also. In test where we are creating local test table and granting permission, I have not revoked the permission at the end as we will be deleting the table by the end of the test, so IMO its not required.

I have reverted the changes from TestAccessController2 as in that class we have 4 tests and all test adds grants, so instead of adding cleanup code in all the test, I have let the tearDown to do that.

Srikanth Srungarapu

Please rename setUp() and tearDown() methods

Addressed.

Please review.
Thanks

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12732196/HBASE-13658-v1.patch
against master branch at commit 9e131dfa8e1303306bb064aac489d8df43b8459b.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12732196

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 4 new or modified tests.

Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14025//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14025//console

This message is automatically generated.
Andrew Purtell can you review v1 patch.

Hi Ashish Singh, the v1 patch is better. Some comments:

  • The table delete for cleaning up after testMergeRegions should be in the finally part of a try-finally wrapping the code after table create succeeds.
  • The disable and re-enable of the test table at the end of testBulkLoad should be in the finally part of a try-finally that wraps the unit test code.
  • testPostGrantRevoke, testPostGrantRevokeAtQualifierLevel, and testPermissionList are still creating its own table for the test. Want to fix that too?
  • Changes made by testGrantRevoke, testPostGrantRevoke, testPostGrantRevokeAtQualifierLevel, testPermissionList, testAccessControlClientGlobalGrantRevoke, testAccessControlClientGrantRevokeOnNamespace, testCoprocessorExec should be cleaned up in a finally block

Thanks Andrew Purtell for the review.

◾The table delete for cleaning up after testMergeRegions should be in the finally part of a try-finally wrapping the code after table create succeeds.

Addressed.

◾The disable and re-enable of the test table at the end of testBulkLoad should be in the finally part of a try-finally that wraps the unit test code.

Addressed.

◾testPostGrantRevoke, testPostGrantRevokeAtQualifierLevel, and testPermissionList are still creating its own table for the test. Want to fix that too?

Done.

◾Changes made by testGrantRevoke, testPostGrantRevoke, testPostGrantRevokeAtQualifierLevel, testPermissionList, testAccessControlClientGlobalGrantRevoke, testAccessControlClientGrantRevokeOnNamespace, testCoprocessorExec should be cleaned up in a finally block

For testPostGrantRevoke, testPostGrantRevokeAtQualifierLevel, and testPermissionList as per the above comment the table will be deleted at the end so no other explicit cleanup is required I think.

Ok, thanks, +1 on the v2 patch
+1 from here too. Will commit this tomorrow unless objection.

Thanks for +1s.
Attached 0.98 patch.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12734824/HBASE-13658-0.98-1.patch
against 0.98 branch at commit f8893e0012031a8c623d9da3839e757006878396.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12734824

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 4 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ verifyDenied(getGlobalPermissionsAction, USER_CREATE, USER_OWNER, USER_RW, USER_RO, USER_NONE);
+ grantOnTable(TEST_UTIL, tblUser.getShortName(), tableName, null, null, Permission.Action.READ);
+ verifyAllowed(getTableDescAction, SUPERUSER, USER_ADMIN, USER_CREATE, USER_OWNER, TABLE_ADMIN);

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

-1 core zombie tests. There are 5 zombie test(s):

The patch for 0.98 is failing on my local box with the following error, every time I tried to run it.


-------------------------------------------------------

 T E S T S

-------------------------------------------------------

Picked up JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS: -Djava.awt.headless=false

Running org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessController

Tests run: 51, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 53.872 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessController

testBulkLoad(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessController)  Time elapsed: 0.375 sec  <<< ERROR!

java.io.IOException: java.io.IOException: The connection has to be unmanaged.

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HConnectionManager$HConnectionImplementation.getTable(HConnectionManager.java:812)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HConnectionManager$HConnectionImplementation.getTable(HConnectionManager.java:796)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.tool.Canary.sniff(Canary.java:700)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.tool.Canary.sniff(Canary.java:685)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.tool.Canary.sniff(Canary.java:670)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.waitTableEnabled(HBaseTestingUtility.java:2767)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.waitTableEnabled(HBaseTestingUtility.java:2734)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessController$BulkLoadHelper.bulkLoadHFile(TestAccessController.java:929)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessController$BulkLoadHelper.access$900(TestAccessController.java:872)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessController$31.run(TestAccessController.java:853)

	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)

	at javax.security.auth.Subject.doAs(Subject.java:415)

	at org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation.doAs(UserGroupInformation.java:1491)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.User$SecureHadoopUser.runAs(User.java:318)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.SecureTestUtil.verifyAllowed(SecureTestUtil.java:157)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.SecureTestUtil.verifyAllowed(SecureTestUtil.java:173)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TestAccessController.testBulkLoad(TestAccessController.java:862)





Results :





Tests in error: 

  TestAccessController.testBulkLoad:862->SecureTestUtil.verifyAllowed:173->SecureTestUtil.verifyAllowed:157 » IO

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #6510 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6510/)
HBASE-13658 Improve the test run time for TestAccessController class (Ashish Singhi) (ssrungarapu: rev 7662980798c82a239c4d446c290595836ed3a456)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/access/TestAccessController.java
This patch applied on 1.0 related branches will fail testTruncatePerms. Looks like HBASE-7782 can fix this. Following up there.

Thanks a lot Srikanth for checking this.
I am not sure how it is failing for you on 0.98 I ran locally 3 times it passed all time for me before uploading the patch and even QA did not report it. Anyways I will check this on all branches again on Monday as I am away from my computer this weekend.

Regarding 0.98 version patch. It is always passing to me locally.
Looking at the stack trace you have pasted it looks like something related to canary. I think it is fixed as part of HBASE-13757 yesterday and it seems like it got introduced as part of HBASE-13712 which got committed to 0.98 after I posted my patch here so I could not find that failure.

Will look into branch-1* now.
Yeah, the tests are passing on 0.98 now. Pushed it. For branch-1.x, HBASE-13764 should take care of the test failures.
